title: The New York Times - Old English font... what is it?
content:
So far the closest thing I have found is English Towne. Doesn't look very sharp though.

Any suggestions would be much appreciated.
author: jidoe

comments.content:
Are you talking about the nameplate?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130827074525im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nyt_nameplate_3617.png)

Because I think that was custom-drawn for the paper. And it's been modified over the years.

[EDIT] Also, check out this older thread:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/19590](http://web.archive.org/web/20130827074525/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19590 "http://www.typophile.com/node/19590")
Yeah that's it, thanks for the link... I'll read up.
